intro: Hedyotis glaucifolia var. waimeae, commonly known as the Waimea bluemink, is a flowering plant native to Hawaii. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
